idinfo.useconst: None provided credit is given to the Pennsylvania Fish and Boat Commission (PFBC) as long as the data is in its original unaltered state. If modifications are made to the data set, users are obligated to describe the types of modifications they have made. Users are not to misrepresent PFBC data sets, nor to imply that changes they (users) have made were approved by the PFBC.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

procstep.procdesc: This layer was created based on the 1:24000 National Hydropahy Dataset (NHD) water bodies layer. The appropriate water bodies were copied into the layer based on the regulatory definition of each approved trout water. This resulted in one lake per each defined approved trout water.

qhorizpa.horizpae: Based on the 1:24000 National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) water bodies layer.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Stream name assigned through the Geogpraphic Names Information System (GNIS) - if one did not exist, PFBC name for stream was used
attr.attrdefs: US Geological Survey and Pennsylvania Fish and Boat Commission

attr.attrdef: Unique GNIS Name identifier (-9999 used if GNIS Name did not exist)
County where stream is located (Approved trout waters are defined by County)
Whether stream is open for year-round fishing (No closed season - see full regs at http://sites.state.pa.us/PA_Exec/Fish_Boat/fishpub/summary/yearround.html)
Whether stream is part of the early opening day (March 31) program for trout season
PFBC Region where the stream is located
Map ID used on the PFBC County Guide Maps for the stream
Map ID used on the PFBC County Guide Maps if stream is open for year-round fishing
Latitude of Primary Access - used for driving directions in web GIS
Longitude of Primary Access - used for driving directions in web GIS
Name of Primary Access - used for driving directions in web GIS
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.4.4000
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Mapping and analysis of the approved trout waters in Pennsylvania. Promotion of Pennsylvania trout fishing opportunities.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: Many streams, lakes, ponds, and reservoirs are officially classified as "approved trout waters." This means that these waters contain significant portions that are open to public fishing and are stocked with trout. The waters in this layer are lakes (not flowing waters) classified as "approved trout waters" and these are open to trout harvest during the "extended season" (see Commonwealth Inland Waters). Unlisted tributary streams (those not included in this list of "approved trout waters") are not open to harvest of trout during the "extended season." Only approved trout waters and all waters downstream of approved trout waters are open during this period. Spearing fish is not permitted in any of these waters at any time of the year. These waters are closed to all fishing (including taking of minnows) from March 1 to 8 a.m. on the opening day of the trout season. Some of these waters have been included in the Early Season Trout-Stocked Waters Program and are open from March 1 through March 31. A person shall be deemed to be fishing if he or she has in possession any fishing line, rod, or other device that can be used for fishing while on or in any water or on the banks within 25 feet of any water where fishing is prohibited. Check with the nearest Fish & Boat Commission office if there is any question about whether or not a water area is "approved." This layer is current through the new fishing regulations released December of 2006 for the 2007 fishing season.

Consts.useLimit: None provided credit is given to the Pennsylvania Fish and Boat Commission (PFBC) as long as the data is in its original unaltered state. If modifications are made to the data set, users are obligated to describe the types of modifications they have made. Users are not to misrepresent PFBC data sets, nor to imply that changes they (users) have made were approved by the PFBC.

distinfo.distliab: The USER shall indemnify, save harmless, and, if requested, defend those parties involved with the development and distribution of this data, their officers, agents, and employees from and against any suits, claims, or actions for injury, death, or property damage arising out of the use of or any defect in the FILES or any accompanying documentation. Those parties involved with the development and distribution excluded any and all implied warranties, including warranties or merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose and makes no warranty or representation, either express or implied, with respect to the FILES or accompanying documentation, including its quality, performance, merchantability, or fitness for a particular purpose. The FILES and documentation are provided "as is" and the USER assumes the entire risk as to its quality and performance. Those parties involved with the development and distribution of this data will not be liable for any direct, indirect, special, incidental, or consequential damages arising out of the use or inability to use the FILES or any accompanying documentation.
